Questions.question: What is Git?
What does the term "repo" stand for in Git?
Which command is used to initialize a Git repository in a directory?
What command is used to stage changes for a commit in Git?
Which command is used to view the status of your changes in Git?
What command is used to create a new branch in Git?
Which command is used to merge branches in Git?
What command is used to revert changes to a specific commit in Git?
Which command is used to push changes from a local repository to a remote repository in Git?
What command is used to clone a remote repository to your local machine in Git?
What does the command 'git pull' do in Git?
answers: Pushes changes from a local repository to a remote repository
Fetches changes from a remote repository and merges them into the current branch
Creates a new branch in the local repository
Reverts changes made in the working directory
Questions.correct: Fetches changes from a remote repository and merges them into the current branch

Questions.question: What is the purpose of the '.gitignore' file in a Git repository?
answers: To list files that should never be committed to the repository
To specify which files should always be included in commits
To store the credentials for accessing remote repositories
To define the structure of the repository
Questions.correct: To list files that should never be committed to the repository

Questions.question: What does the 'HEAD' pointer refer to in Git?
answers: The latest commit on the current branch
The index where changes are staged before committing
The main branch of the repository
Questions.correct: The latest commit on the current branch

Questions.question: Which command is used to create and switch to a new branch in Git?
What is a 'merge conflict' in Git?
answers: A situation where multiple branches can be merged without conflict
An error that occurs when attempting to merge branches
A situation where Git cannot determine which changes to accept during a merge
A conflict between team members regarding the use of Git
Questions.correct: A situation where Git cannot determine which changes to accept during a merge

Questions.question: What is the purpose of the command 'git rebase'?
answers: To merge changes from one branch into another branch
To rewrite the commit history of a branch
To revert changes made in a specific commit
Questions.correct: To rewrite the commit history of a branch

Questions.question: What does the command 'git cherry-pick' do?
answers: Creates a new branch from a specific commit
Applies the changes introduced by some existing commits
Undoes the changes made in a specific commit
Deletes a branch from the repository
Questions.correct: Applies the changes introduced by some existing commits

Questions.question: Which Git command is used to show the commit history for a specific branch?
What is the purpose of the 'git stash' command?
answers: To discard changes in the working directory
To temporarily store changes that are not ready to be committed
To create a backup of the entire repository
Questions.correct: To temporarily store changes that are not ready to be committed

What is encapsulation in object-oriented programming (OOP)?

The ability to inherit properties and behavior from another class
The process of creating multiple instances of a class
The ability to modify the behavior of a method in a subclass
Questions.correct: The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data into a single unit

Questions.question: What is inheritance in object-oriented programming (OOP)?
answers: The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data into a single unit
The ability to inherit properties and behavior from another class
The process of creating multiple instances of a class
The ability to modify the behavior of a method in a subclass
Questions.correct: The ability to inherit properties and behavior from another class

Questions.question: What is polymorphism in object-oriented programming (OOP)?
answers: The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data into a single unit
The ability to inherit properties and behavior from another class
The process of creating multiple instances of a class
The ability to modify the behavior of a method in a subclass
Questions.correct: The ability to modify the behavior of a method in a subclass

answers: A method that belongs to a class

The process of creating multiple instances of a class
The ability to modify the behavior of a method in a subclass

Questions.question: What is the purpose of ADO.NET in C#?
answers: To access and manipulate data in databases.
Questions.correct: To access and manipulate data in databases.

Questions.question: What are the SQL Sublanguages used in database operations?
answers: Data Query Language (DQL), Data Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), Data Control Language (DCL)
Structured Query Language (SQL), Dynamic Query Language (DQL), Database Management Language (DBML), Data Control Language (DCL)
Database Query Language (DQL), Database Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), Data Control Language (DCL)
Data Query Language (DQL), Database Definition Language (DDL), Data Modification Language (DML), Data Control Language (DCL)
Questions.correct: Data Query Language (DQL), Data Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), Data Control Language (DCL)

Questions.question: What does the SELECT statement with a WHERE clause do?
answers: Returns all columns from a table.
Returns all rows from a table.
Returns specific columns from a table based on a condition.
Returns all rows and columns from a table.
Questions.correct: Returns specific columns from a table based on a condition.

Questions.question: What is the purpose of SQL Joins?
answers: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column.
To create new tables from existing tables.
To delete rows from a table.
To insert rows into a table.
Questions.correct: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column.

Questions.question: What is the difference between Inner Join and Left Outer Join (Left Join)?
answers: Inner Join returns all rows from the left table and the matched rows from the right table.
Left Join returns only the rows that have matching values in both tables.
Inner Join returns all rows from both tables, regardless if there is a match.
Left Join returns all rows from the left table and the matched rows from the right table.
Questions.correct: Left Join returns all rows from the left table and the matched rows from the right table.

Questions.question: What are the properties of a Primary Key in SQL?
answers: Allows NULL values and ensures uniqueness.
Does not allow NULL values and ensures uniqueness.
Allows NULL values but does not ensure uniqueness.
Does not allow NULL values but does not ensure uniqueness.
Questions.correct: Does not allow NULL values and ensures uniqueness.

Questions.question: What is a Foreign Key in SQL?
answers: A key that uniquely identifies each record in a table.
A key that establishes a relationship between two tables.
A key that defines the primary structure of a table.
A key that determines access permissions.
Questions.correct: A key that establishes a relationship between two tables.

Questions.question: How do NULL values behave within a Join query in SQL?
answers: NULLs are treated as empty strings.
NULLs cause an error in the query.
NULLs are excluded unless handled with IS NULL or COALESCE.
NULLs are included regardless of the join condition.
Questions.correct: NULLs are excluded unless handled with IS NULL or COALESCE.

answers: To execute code only if no exception occurs.
To execute code even if an exception occurs.
To catch all exceptions and prevent them from crashing the program.

Questions.question: What is the difference between public, private, and internal access modifiers in C#?
answers: Public: Accessible only within the same class. Private: Accessible from anywhere. Internal: Accessible only within the same assembly.
Public: Accessible from anywhere. Private: Accessible only within the same class. Internal: Accessible only within the same assembly.
Public: Accessible only within the same assembly. Private: Accessible only within the same class. Internal: Accessible from anywhere.
Public: Accessible only within the same class. Private: Accessible only within the same assembly. Internal: Accessible from anywhere.
Questions.correct: Public: Accessible from anywhere. Private: Accessible only within the same class. Internal: Accessible only within the same assembly.

Questions.question: What is the difference between == and != in C#?
answers: ==: Checks if two operands are equal. !=: Checks if two operands are not equal.
==: Checks if two operands are not equal. !=: Checks if two operands are equal.
==: Checks if one operand is greater than the other. !=: Checks if one operand is less than the other.
==: Checks if one operand is less than the other. !=: Checks if one operand is greater than the other.
Questions.correct: ==: Checks if two operands are equal. !=: Checks if two operands are not equal.

Questions.question: What is the difference between a for loop and a foreach loop in C#?
answers: For loop is used when you need to iterate through a collection with an index, while foreach loop is used for iterating through a collection without needing the index.
Foreach loop is used when you need to iterate through a collection with an index, while for loop is used for iterating through a collection without needing the index.
For loop can only iterate forward, while foreach loop can iterate both forward and backward.
Foreach loop can only iterate forward, while for loop can iterate both forward and backward.
Questions.correct: For loop is used when you need to iterate through a collection with an index, while foreach loop is used for iterating through a collection without needing the index.

Questions.question: What is an interface in C#?
answers: A contract that defines a set of members that implementing classes must provide.
Questions.correct: A contract that defines a set of members that implementing classes must provide.
